definition: to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently

sentences.english: Her quarters were right next to my Master Suite.
sentences.chinese: 她的四分之一是正確地緊鄰我的主人隨員。

sentences.english: The president gave the Prince and his attendants a farewell banquet.
sentences.chinese: 總統爲王子和他的隨員舉行了告別宴會。

sentences.english: These limitations reach into the executive suite.
sentences.chinese: 這些限制還影響到了高管隨員。

sentences.english: I do not want to be one of the swines in your entourage.
sentences.chinese: 我不想與您的隨員中那些卑劣的傢伙們爲伍。

sentences.english: He strode past with his retinue of aides.
sentences.chinese: 他與他的隨員們大步走了過去。

sentences.english: We were unable to see the ambassador, but we spoke to one of the attaches.
sentences.chinese: 我們不能夠見大使，但是我們可以同大使隨員談一下。

definition: to denounce/to condemn/to call to account/to punish
commander-in-chief, the equivalent of king in Chinese chess
to be in overall charge/to oversee
to visit a prisoner (usu. a relative or friend)
internal affairs/domestic affairs/family affairs/(trad.) affairs within the palace
Zhang Zhizhong (1890-1969), National Revolutionary Army general
security measures (esp. border security)/official seal (esp. military seal during Qing and Ming times)
to forfeit sovereignty and humiliate the country (idiom)/to surrender territory under humiliating terms
